Well, this game certainly isn't what I thought I'd be doing today. (Especially since I'm investigating this place... but maybe it won't be all bad.)
Hmm, I haven't played poker much, but I remember the rules. I'll have to learn it's tricks quickly as I go, thanks to what I have in mind.

This seems like the right place. My interface says it is, at least: the Inventory. (I am here to investigate the place, but if possible... maybe I can get used to this kind of situation, and grow more confident in myself.)

The Inventory doesn't look much like a skeevy place, but looks can be deceiving. (And if it is illegal, I'll do something about that... but even if not, a bit more experience might not be a bad thing.)

(A goddess? Here, playing this? I never expected that!)
How is... wait, if you're a goddess, are you from my world or another?

condition.saying: You and I killed every monster in the Underground. We will defeat the enemies in this world, too. It is inevitable.

Oh, sorry about that, Lux. Me and my friends use them so often that it's a habit, and because they're easier to say than the full names.

Well, RPG means "Role Playing Game". It's a specific genre that tackles us playing a character in a fictional setting, which can have a wide range of stories to tell. There's also many sub-genres of RPGs too.

VR means "Virtual Reality"; it's like diving into a dream, but the sensations are like real life. MMO means "Massively Multiplayer Online"... basically, a lot of players doing game stuff at the same time.

Well, because GGO - Gun Gale Online - is a game, we don't actually get hurt using guns. It's like... solid dummies do all our actions for us, but we control them and experience everything through them.

Mmh, Yui's always curious about stuff. Meeting a real-life goddess would be sure to make her excited.
Even now I still think about Sword Art Online, the first VRMMO of its kind. A beautiful world with a floating castle, great RPG mechanics... and my literal home for two years.
(In a way, each hand is almost like clearing a Floor: you have to face a boss - in this case, other players - just to advance.)
This place apparently has a no-touching rule... I'm glad, but I can't help but remember that SAO had the same thing, in a way.
(In most games, PvP is just heated battles, and that kinda applies here with the 'betting'. In SAO... people who did that were knowingly committing murder.)
SAO was a complete virtual experience: you could taste food, feel the wind, and a lot more. You could feel tired and hungry.
SAO could render a lot of realistic details - mostly when you were looking at them - but it had difficulty with water... hmm.
Rather than having levels and skills, Alfheim Online just has skill development. And heavy focus on PvP... the safe kind, thankfully.
Flying in ALO was always a great sensation even when it was limited, or so I heard. But I only started playing after unlimited flight was granted to everyone.
(Hmm, I remember Yui telling me that you could use a controller to fly in ALO, and Kirito had trouble with it at first... hehe. I wish I could've seen that.)
(Unlike SAO, which was "meant" to be lived in, ALO's moral codes can't be turned off. That's probably for the best, but at the same time it's... u-uh, well uh...)
Even though death in ALO isn't really a big deal, it's still a little hard for me. After all, I did live in fear of death for two years...
ALO does have nine fairy races, but the previous Grand Quest apparently had a tenth one as a reward... which was a complete utter lie.
Unlike most VRMMO's, Gun Gale Online is well, all about guns and such hehe. It's also a lot more sci-fi than fantasy, but I guess that's part of it's appeal.
One thing I appreciate about GGO, as a gamer, is that you have to know what path your character will take beforehand; there's no easy resets.
Despite mostly being about guns, there are a few sword-like weapons in GGO. Kazuto and I both use them to deflect bullets in-game... it kinda makes us famous.
I and most of my friends got into GGO late... Kirito didn't, because he dove head-first into a dangerous situation, again. I get that's who my boyfriend is, but he really worried us!
(Without GGO's bullet-assist system, I'm not sure Kazuto and I would be able to deflect bullets in-game. After all, we kinda just predict the predictive paths... or that's how he puts it.)
Watching the BoB tournament in GGO was fun, at least before we learned what was going on. I just hope me and my friends might try the next one.
Since Ordinal Scale is an augmented game, only the players perceive any changes. To passerby though, we might look rather silly.
Unlike virtual reality, where you're basically sleeping, augmented reality happens while you're wide awake. It's a great way to have fun and exercise.
(It's a shame Kazuto isn't into Ordinal Scale more. I worry about him not getting enough exercise, and sometimes he even forgets to eat while working.)
Rather than levels, we have rankings in Ordinal Scale; the higher, the better of course. But of course skill is still very important.
Even though it nearly ended badly, I do hope Ordinal Scale has more appearances of former SAO boss monsters in the future.
Although I do miss having Sword Skills, it's nice that in OS, you can practice anywhere on your own time. You don't have to throw yourself into battle.
It's off... thank god I remembered! Now then, back to- uh? Wait, I lost?
*sigh* That could've been a nightmare... oh, my cards. (Is my hand really the lowest?)

condition.saying: Please forget about this when you return to the real world!

case.state: ...Y-You and me both. (Never thought I'd be saying that to myself, but still!)
I-If only I could... if only everyone else could too!
(If the Augma incident could erase my memories of this particular game, I might not actually mind! ...Even if that's only because I'm steaming right now!)

condition.saying: What? This is the quest reward?!

case.state: Not only did I lose, my other self did too. I-I don't know how to feel about that... (including if that's good or bad, or both!)
(A-As if I didn't already have enough reasons not to mention this game to anyone!)
Y-Yeah, some reward this is...

condition.saying: Fifty points to Gryffindor!

case.state: ...I-I don't know what you're counting towards, but good for you, Hermione. (I guess.)
(Normally I'd be curious about that... b-but not while I'm like this!)
...You do know you're kinda rubbing it in, right Hermione?

condition.saying: Don't be ashamed being beaten by the brightest witch of her generation.

case.state: I'm not ashamed about that, Hermione. I-It's more that I lost, and had to do all that in front of strangers... I'm not sure how I'm going to make the most of that.
...You really take pride in being called a witch, Hermione? T-That's new to me.
(She... did strike me as a smart one. I-I guess this just proves her claim.)

condition.saying: I've got one word for you, ~name~: Obliviate.

case.state: Wait, w-what are you doing, Hermione?
W-What is that spell... ah, are their eyes unfocusing?
(How... wait, d-did Hermione just affect their memory!?)

condition.saying: Congratulations. I hope the ego boost helps you compensate for that tiny penis.

case.state: H-Hey! There's no need to be rude, Nugi-chan!
Ah! Nugi-chan's j-just messing with you, ~player~! (Not really, but still!)
Y-You're just fine as you are, ~player~! (Even if I wish we hadn't seen each other like this... b-but that aside, it's still true!)

condition.saying: I mean, I won, but considering how little I have left, it's a hollow victory.

case.state: E-Even a hollow victory is better than none at all!
(But at least you didn't have to do the forfeit!)
Mmh... I-I want to say that's wrong, but I'd probably feel the same way...

condition.saying: I'm glad I won and all, but I'm going to get dressed now, if you don't mind.

case.state: H-Hardly, Palutena. In fact, I'm gonna do the same right now!
N-Nope... but I really wish I could've won instead...
(Well, it could've been worse... she could've rigged the game against us all...)
(I know deities are expected to be better at most everything, but this was still way too lopsided!)
I swear, Palutena... you better not have rigged this game, or else...
(If her stats have high luck, I might be able to understand this result. If not...)
H-Hey, why are you jumping around like that, Chun-Li?
(I know you're glad that you won and all, but did you really have to jump all over the place, Chun-Li?)
If that'd been me, I would've been far more relieved than happy... a-and I wouldn't have jumped around either.

condition.saying: Thanks for getting me all horny, everyone. Ah, fuck it, I'll give you guys an encore in the backroom, if you're interested...

case.state: F-Fat chance of that, Zone-tan...
(It's like she doesn't even care for the fact that I have a boyfriend... or that's how she's sounding right now!)
I'm not in the slightest bit interested, Zone-tan! I'm out of here a-as soon as I get dressed!
The only time I've had amnesia, it was done against my will. But now, I- I'm kinda tempted to not remember this experience... I mean, I'm not gonna let that happen, but I'm just saying!
S-So, I've found out that the the Inventory wasn't illegal. It's sleazy... but not that. (And I learned a bunch of things tonight, as well...)
(I know poker is a game of luck, but this was just ridiculous!)
If I ever see any of you again, you'd better not say a word about this game!
When I say forget this ever happened, I-I mean it! (Even if I won't...)
N-Not even a reward. The rules didn't state anything about one, but I don't know if one would've helped, or just felt like a slap in the face!

(D-Did I really just play with myself in front of strangers? ...Well, um, the fact that I'm not freaking out is a good sign! At the very least, I would want to feel less embarrassed after an experience like this!)
Mmh. Well, even though I lost... at least Yui and Strea haven't- h-huh? Who is...?
...Well, I'm more relaxed than I ever thought I'd be in this situation. I-I don't know how I feel about that; so much happened at once, and I'll need some time to think...
(Mmh, at least I can finally head home now... I did get my answer about the Inventory, as well, a-and more of an intense experience then I was expecting....)
T-This result wasn't ideal... but I guess it wasn't quite as bad as I thought it was. (I-It even felt sorta... good, in a way.)
S-So uh... can everyone agree never to talk about this ever again? (Still, I felt more... r-relaxed and okay with this sexual situation, than I expected...)
Well, um... good job winning, ~name~. Just please, don't mention this to anyone.
Mmh... (W-Why did I have to lose? I-I learned a bunch about myself, but I would've preferred if it was less sudden! But... at least it was all girls tonight.)
I suppose this c-could've been worse... because it always could've been worse.
I guess this wasn't... quite as bad as I thought it would be, I guess. E-Even if that's only because it was all girls.
(I suppose I can live this down... b-but it's gonna take some time to sort out everything I felt tonight.)
I-I tried so hard... but I still had to r-rub myself out in front of a guy, and several girls. This w-was... strangely intense...
~Name~ won... b-but I can't really bring myself to congratulate them. (At least, not right now; I still need to sort out everything I'm feeling.)
(E-Even if I learned a lot about myself today, why did a guy have to show up to see me do all that?)
P-Please, ~name~, everyone... just forget that I was ever here!
At... at least now this game is over. (N-Not that I'm gonna forget this anytime soon! I-Including how intense it was... in more ways than one...)
T-This feels too much like a power fantasy! Like you guys got off on winning against me!
Someone p-please tell me this was a nightmare! T-That I really didn't just do all that!
(Itsabaddream! Itsabaddream! Itsabaddream!)
I-It's finally over...!
G-Great, now can you guys make yourselves scarce? (I really wanna get dressed and go home!)
I-If this experience doesn't make it easier for the... next times, I don't know what will.
(Well, I won't be forgetting this place anytime soon. But still... I can use this experience to better myself, even if it might be hard.)
(I know Kazuto likes me as I am, but I'm sure he wouldn't mind if I got more... comfortable with situations like this. I want to as well, e-even if it'll take more than one game.)

condition.saying:
Ah, forgive me. I let myself go a little in the heat of the moment.
I have some... minor anger issues...
